TLDR;
While this game is unique and for a starter will offer some hours of fun, as you get more experienced you'll likely tend to get sick of bad balance changes in this already unbalanced game, and the toxic community at some point. 

Intro:
I have played this game for roughly 3 years in general, with this steam account I have roughly 800 hours, however in total I would likely have over 5000 hours as I use to play on console. 
I had nearly every killer P3 Level 50 and every Survivor at least P1, I recall this would take an average player thousands of hours to do, and therefore is a basis for why I state
this playtime without having an actual hour playtime indicator on Playstation. 

I plan to give an in-depth review about this game because while I don't recommend it I would like to see it fix its issues so I can.


-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_ The Game _-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-

Pros:
A new player will very likely have a great deal of fun while playing for their first 20 - 500 hours depending on their experiences, their natural skill level, and adaptation.
Those who are more casual especially will be able to get that value in playtime for reasons I will talk about later in this review. 

Another thing is this game is indeed unique in its idea, and execution. For example, as a Survivor you see in the third person, however, The Killer sees in the first person. This subtle but noticeable change makes it possible for counterplay on both sides and in itself allows strategies based solely on this perspective shift such as a tactic known as "Moonwalking". The Killer always has a red light directly in front of where they are looking,
so in the third person, a survivor can angle their camera to then be able to see this red light around corners and in turn react before The Killer and survivor can see each other. The killer can then "Moonwalk", basically walking backward to hide this red light, and as result either throw off the survivor or give themselves more time to close more distance than normal allowing for the potential of a hit.

Like Rainbow Six Siege, you may find it difficult to find another game like Dead By Daylight that is dominant in this genre of game in your market. At least that is the case for me in the American market.

Artwork (Concept Art) and the way things look is excellent when they decide to focus on such things, with the new chapter being released, they went all out on Pinhead's (The Cenobite) 
unique animations and they look nice. Recently they also did an overhaul to the appearance of several maps, which also looks nice, especially the Cold Wind maps.

These are some of the good few things I can say about the game unfortunately and that is the reason I wanted to state these pros, and then move into the negatives.
                                                   
Cons:
For once, while a game looks nice and has some unique ideas, this game completely fails in the category of balance. This is why this game is stuck as a casual game, and will likely never be a successful E-Sport. 

The balance in this game is broken for several reasons but the main reason is because of the already strong base kit for survivors, perks that outright fix mistakes, items that 
also fix mistakes while also increasing their main objective speed, and every map (If played correctly for some, but others are so broken that you don't need to play them correctly) 
outright being insanely forgiving.

 For example, in this game as a survivor, you have a potential base of 3 lives, which isn't that bad in theory. However, when you look at the potential for perks, you can add additional lives outright. 
Let's just stick to the meta, because this is what you likely will be playing vs. Deadhard, one of the game's most prolific perks currently allows you to outright achieve an additional minimum of 3 lives guaranteed almost no matter what with correct usage. 
A survivor who waits to use it near the killer is using this perk incorrectly, when using this perk it should always be used for correcting fatal mistakes, or directly extending the amount of time
the killer must chase the survivor to chain to pallets and windows that you normally wouldn't be able to reach (which is in itself a different issue, but one point at a time). 
	
Mind you this is ONE perk, the other 3 you can equip (Max is 4 perks at one time). There is also Prove thyself, giving a 15% buff to repair speed that stacks with every nearby survivor for an insane and incredibly noticeable buff to gen speed. This makes survivors complete their main objective (Generators) at a huge accelerated rate. There are also perks like Borrowed Time that survivors typically abuse in the modern-day for extra lives rather than use them as they likely were originally intended. In modern times, Borrowed Time makes you impervious to any type of damage for one hit for 12 seconds. 
The list goes on, there are a lot of perks you will typically see that will just be used over and over again because in this game perks typically only fall into the category of terrible, meh, or great. I can go on and on about perks because there are some other prolific ones, so I would like to speak upon the other things I have stated as to not waste a bunch of time.
	
Maps, very much the newest one (RPD Station) can be on a scale from horrendous to bad all depending on the map. The reason for this type has to do with Pallet and Window formations. As a new player, you will start to see patterns in formations around the map, and these formations will dictate how safe or dangerous any particular map is. For example, T-Walls (formations with two windows and no pallets) are pretty fair for both sides. However, you commonly will see formations that are insanely safe such as shack pallet that has near no real counterplay unless you play specific killers.
	
Lastly, items, Toolbox makes gens repair even faster as its practical and common use. Medkits heal and have an addon to near-instant heal (literally). You can take two hits before you are downed as a survivor, in which case The Killer can pick you up and put you on a hook, and only then taking one of your lives which if the survivors don't unhook you will slowly result in your death and lost lives although the timing on this is forgiving, so this is very unlikely.
	
Contrast this with the killers, they're perks simply trying to slow down the game or down quicker such as Ruin that makes gens regress when a survivor isn't working on it, Undying that saves a Hex totem once, BBQ you can see survivors through walls for a few seconds, etc. 
        
Killers are completely outclassed in this set. (Also Hex perks, unique to the killer, basically spawn physically on the map, and can be destroyed, as a result removing that perk for the
rest of the game.)
	
Maps are commonly unforgiving for The Killer.
	Instead of items, The killer has addons a few of which are busted, although survivors can still play through them and if the team of survivors knows what they are doing it will still be hell for The Killer to make progress.
	
What this translates too, is the survivor is much easier and The Killer is insanely competitive. Gen speed in itself is low, all gens can and have been done in 3 minutes. This means if you play killer, vs better survivors you are strickly forced to play optimized if you want any chance of even drawing the game. Meaning, you must use some of the best killers, you must use the same meta perks like what the survivors likely will be, and you must play the best move regardless of  how unfun it might be if you want to actively compete with good survivors. 
	
This is all because all of the things The Survivors have going on for them only pile and pile and pile until it's a mountain and because of this "Camping" or "Tunnelling" will be mandatory strategies, making this balance unfun for both sides.

Dead By Daylight is an amazingly simple, yet fun, multiplayer survival horror game. As a survivor, you fix generators and try to get out of the nightmare you're stuck in. As a killer, you need to kill the survivors. They have managed to obtain several licenses to certain characters, such as those from Resident Evil and Nightmare on Elm Street. Even if you don't win a match, it's still an amazing amount of fun and I highly recommend it!
takes eons to get into a game, also trickster/ legion players
this game go hard and is hella scary

430 hours in, I figure I should probably weigh in.

This is by far my favorite online multiplayer game. Every match tells a story of 4 survivors trying to escape an area without being caught and sacrificed by the killer. Every match is different and feels unique start to finish and somehow just doesn't get old. Each time you face a different killer (or set of survivors) in a different location where the set pieces you will use to escape (or kill) spawn in different spots so you can't ever memorize where to go. The gameplay loop created from this is incredibly satisfying and the perk & item/add-on systems give you a reason to farm up extra bloodpoints by doing daily objectives and (monthly?) challenges.

As someone who loves stealth and hide & seek games like Splinter Cell & Outlast, this game scratches that itch and I can play it with friends! I'm also a big fan of horror movies and games as well so the vibe here is perfect. Playing as the killer is also really fun!

10/10 - Bravo, possibly my favorite game ever.

Comecei a jogar DbD na verão mobile (muitas e muitas horas kk) e caso vocês forem comprar vai algumas dicas:

1 - Não tenha medo! É um jogo de "terror", mas o quanto antes vc perder o medo melhor você fica (claro, sempre haverá sustinhos rs)
2 - Veja vídeos na Internet, o tutorial não te ensina quase nada, não dependa dele (e vc sofre no começo)
3 - Jogue com os amigos! Simplesmente vai melhorar 1000%
4 - Não ligue para o chat! No fim das partidas, sempre há um chat, não se importe, uma hora ou outra todos seremos xingados rs
5 - Espere promoções: o jogo sempre entra em promoção (as DLCs tbm). Espere um pouco que vc economiza muito!!

Final notes:550+ hours on console. Do i have to say anything else? playing since 2019 and never got sick of it. This is the face of asymetrical-horror games

The Problem With This Game Is The MMR System
As a casual player it's actually disgustingly annoying to play this game at the moment
Some games are really fun and I don't mind getting 0,1,2 kills and typically give the 4th person hatch for fun if they don't wiggle

Some games are a bit sweatier, and that's okay... until the sweaty games become most games
Keys, Toolboxes, Medkits, Flashlights everygame
Dead Hard, Decisive, Borrowed Time
SWF Running Breakout and Kindred to help each other

Vice Versa as a survivor killers seem to always want 4 kills in the speediest time playing top tier killers

You can't be casual, you can't play casual, you need to play sweat to win and endure the worst of the worst 99% of games

The few games that go well, you meet AMAZING people and have the MOST fun, and yet sometimes even those games bring some annoying people who question logical decisions.

J'aime ce jeu, vraiment, le gameplay survivant est exceptionnel, l'ambiance est vraiment trop cool et tout mais j'ai envie de casser un truc quand j'y joue. La raison? Et bien j'ai pas une connexion très stable malheureusement, et dans ce jeu la moindre mini coupure de co vous coupe de la partie, evidemment sans possibilités de se reconnecter + vous empêche de jouer de suite après, alors qu'il suffirait juste de laisser un modèle 3D immobile la ou je suis, ça n'handicaperait personne à part les gens comme moi. Bref un excellent jeu, très fun entre potes et à try hard, mais vraiment à fuir si vous avez pas une bonne co. Les devs faites quelque chose pitié je veux juste jouer à la base pas exploser mon bureau
This is a game that takes a lot of time to get good at but it is very worth it.

Dead by Daylight est un jeu asymétrique dont l'objectif est différent en fonction du rôle que vous incarnez.
Jusque là, je ne vous apprends rien de plus que sur le résumé de la page du jeu.

Plus sérieusement, et moins académiquement, le jeu "Mort d'ici l'aube" est un jeu pour lequel je mettrai la note de "Je peux m'amuser assez longtemps dessus avec des potes sans me faire chier".

Dead By daylight est un bon jeu, le problème, c'est sa communauté.
Avec Dead By Daylight, vous perdrez vos cheveux bien plus rapidement que prévu ! Et oui, le stress étant une des causes de l'alopécie prématurée, jouer à DBD est un bon moyen de finir comme Vin Diesel, Bruce Willis ou Dwayne Johnson ! Seulement, vous ne serez pas aussi beaux qu'eux, rip.

Dead by Daylight ou "DBD" pour les aficionados est un jeu qui vous fera stresser, bien évidemment, mais surtout rire ! Le nombre de situation improbable et de tension exaltante, ne manquent pas aux rendez-vous. 

***********SURVIVANTS************
Du côté des humanoïdes, votre objectif étant de genrush comme des gros porcs (c'est à dire user de vos meilleurs compétences en ingénierie basique du type faire une Kokot), vous passerez de très bon moments à vous prendre des screamers de tueurs qui vous interrompent discrètement durant votre réparation, wlh (aka Mickael Myers du Film Halloween). 

DBD est aussi un jeu très réaliste où un survivant d'approximativement 1m70 peut tourner en rond autour d'une table pendant de très longues minutes et éviter de se faire tuer par un grand géant de 3 mètres de haut avec une tronçonneuse. C'est tout à fait cohérent, vous y trouverez beaucoup de plaisir ! N'oubliez surtout pas de vous T-Bag (c'est à dire vous accroupir et vous relevez pour faire rager votre poursuivant), ça réduira votre stress ! Aussi, vous pourrez utiliser des lampes de poches de chez Decathlon pour éblouir votre adversaire... mais ce n'est que secondaire. Le but principal de ces torches électriques est de cliquer à l'infini pour faire plein de bruit, c'est un excellent remède contre les acouphènes !

***********TUEURS***************

Si vous avez toujours refoulé votre furieuse envie de tuer des gens dans la vraie vie, comme par exemple ceux qui mettent leur masque en dessous du nez, et bien dans Mort d'ici l'aube, vous pourrez assouvir cette soif de haine pur et dure !

De plus, si vous êtes un bon tueur, vous pourrez régulièrement récolter les messages de haine des survivants qui vous ont fait tourner autour d'un rocher pendant toute la partie, mais en vain, puisque vous les avez finalement tué :).

Mieux encore, si vous avez fait les scouts ou êtes un vétéran de la Grand Guerre (14-18) vous pourrez "camper" devant les corps suspendus des homo sapiens sapiens (car ils s'apparentent un peu à des singes ces survivants), cela vous remémorer vos meilleurs moments entre amis quand vous êtes tout seul *v*. Car oui, joueur tueur, c'est accepter d'établir une relation privilégiée avec soi-même et tendre vers un certain épicurisme, sauf qu'ici, au lieu de cueillir le jour, ce sont les survivants ah-ah-ah.


*******CONCLUSION**********

S'il vous prend l'envie de vous amuser à tuer des gens de toute sorte de manière, à rendre des bugs plutôt régulier, n'hésitez pas à vous rendre sur Bug by Daylight comme j'ai l'appeler ! Plus vous jouerez à ce jeu et moins vous aurez foi en la bonté et piété de l'espèce humaine !

After a year of playing this asymetrical "catch me if you can" game. I do recommend this to you. BUT. Do be careful. You will come across entitled survivors. Dont mess with their precious Survivor Rule book as killer. As long as they win, everything is okay to use. If you Tunnel or Camp. its done. Youll get -reps and insults you never actually heard of. Just remember. If you play survivor.. The killer is a human being to. The Killer also has emotions and feelings like you. If you play Killer. dont take all this Tbagging and flashlight clicky clacky too personal. Anywhoot. Gl HF. its a really cool game guys
